meanings.definition: To cause to lose equilibrium or balance.
meanings.sent1: The earthquake will disequilibrate the carefully stacked books.
meanings.sent2: If you add too much weight to one side, it will disequilibrate the seesaw.
meanings.sent3: Trying to balance a pencil on your nose might disequilibrate your focus.
meanings.sent4: His unexpected question disequilibrated her emotionally.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind disequilibrated the fragile tower of blocks.

meanings.sent1: The table began to disequilibrate as the leg loosened.
meanings.sent2: When the boat hit a wave, it started to disequilibrate.
meanings.sent3: The jenga tower seemed to disequilibrate itself just to challenge the player.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts started to disequilibrate like a spinning top losing momentum.
meanings.sent5: The delicate ecosystem can easily disequilibrate with the introduction of a new species.
